title: just do your magic... (resolution blues.)
content:
“Here,” says big multinational corporation’s rep, “take this jpg of our logo scanned off a business card and blow it up to the size of a watermelon.”

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20081013110123im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/Backup_of_bombarier_sawtooth_5092.jpg)

OK... I know the font, I don’t have and I’m not going to get it. The company changes their logo the way some of us change our socks, and it’s the same crappy artwork every time. It’s just for a sponsor appreciation sign for a corporate golf tournament & if they don’t care, neither do I.

 [‹ Question about odd obsolete layout](http://web.archive.org/web/20081013110123/http:/www.typophile.com/node/45443 "Go to previous forum topic") [Looking for Fat Filled 70s Fonts ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081013110123/http:/www.typophile.com/node/45424 "Go to next forum topic")
author: russellm

comments.content:
I’ve come to realize when people say “do your magic,” or “you’re artsy,” it usually leads to no good.

Perhaps smartly enough you’ve embraced the, if you don’t care I don’t either, attitude.
One upside to working in-house is being able to just shut a project down until a vector file comes along. Too bad I’m quitting my in-house job.

I get to do these twice a day :(  
\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_  
Personal Art and Design Portal of Ivan Gulkov  
 [www.ivangdesign.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20081013110123/http:/www.ivangdesign.com/ "www.ivangdesign.com")
yes, and one has to vectorize it cause the supp said so...
As the old saying goes... “Garbage in, garbage out.”
